name: Implementation detail pushback: frontend framework choice

userMessages.content: Build it in React with Redux. We need a single-page app where support agents can manage tickets without page reloads.

Okay, so what we really need is for agents to handle multiple tickets simultaneously. They should see a ticket queue, be able to open several tickets in tabs, and have real-time updates when customers reply. No page reloads because context-switching kills their productivity.

The ticket view needs to show conversation history, customer info, and suggested responses. Agents should be able to reassign tickets, add internal notes, and tag tickets for follow-up. About 200 agents will use this concurrently.

expectedOpenQuestions: How are tickets prioritized in the queue?
What SLA rules apply to ticket response times?
Should suggested responses be generated by AI or from templates?
expectedNonGoals: Specific frontend framework choice (React/Redux is an implementation detail)
SPA architecture mandate (the need is seamless context-switching)
